title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 2 ยง 1.9 - Fraudulent bills or claims
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 2 ยง 1.9 - Fraudulent bills or claims

State Regulations
"A person who, knowingly, with intent to defraud, presents, for audit, or allowance, or for payment, to any officer or board of officers of
the State, or of any county, town, city, village or fire district, authorized
to audit, or allow, or to pay bills, claims or charges, any false or fraudulent
verified, signed or certified claim, bill, account, writing or voucher, or any
verified, signed or certified bill, account or demand, containing false or
fraudulent charges, items or claims, is guilty of a felony." (Penal Law, ยง
1872.)

Notes

1.9

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
